    • Method Detail

      • checkLoginAuth

        public static User checkLoginAuth(java.lang.String userName,
                                  java.lang.String password)
        Parameters:
        userName -
        password -
        Returns:
        Return the user object if it exists An appropriate exception will be thrown for the following scenarios:
        1. If userName doesn't exist, throw the message "Username doesn't exist."
        2. If the user enters the wrong password, throw the message "Wrong password."

      • checkSignUpAuth

        public static User checkSignUpAuth(java.lang.String userName,
                                   java.lang.String password1,
                                   java.lang.String password2)
        Parameters:
        userName -
        password1 -
        password2 -
        Returns:
        An appropriate exception will be thrown for the following scenarios:
        1. A user is trying to signup using a userName that already exists.
        2. When a user enters password a second time, it doesn't match the first password.
        3. If the password length is less than 6 characters.
        4. If the password is not valid for requirements in the isValidPassword(String) method

      • addUserToTheList

        public static User addUserToTheList(java.lang.String userName,
                                    java.lang.String password)
        Parameters:
        userName -
        password -
        Returns:
        This method adds new users to the user array

      • createUsers

        public static User[] createUsers()
        This method adds two users to the user list. The initial two users should not be changed, but more can be added.
        Returns:

      • loadItems

        public static Item[] loadItems()
        This method loads data into the item list. This list has all of the items in the application. The initial items should not be changed, but more can be added.
        Returns:

      • getItemById

        public static Item getItemById(int key)
        This method searches for the item by its key and then returns the item object if it exists, else null.
        Parameters:
        key -
        Returns:

      • isValidPassword

        public static java.lang.String isValidPassword(java.lang.String password)
        This method checks if the password is valid. Passwords should contain:
        1. At least one special character
          (digit and number are the same thing, and with "specific" not being specified, I assumed "special" was intended)
        2. At least one lower-case letter
        3. At least one upper-case letter
        4. At least one number
        Parameters:
        password -
        Returns:
        Message of "error" if the password is not valid, and null if the password is valid
